articles.headline: Trumps Put Their Washington Hotel on the Market
articles.snippet: President Trump has drawn frequent criticism for ownership of the hotel because it hosts foreign diplomats and corporate executives with business before his administration.
articles.abstract: President Trump has drawn frequent criticism for ownership of the hotel because it hosts foreign diplomats and corporate executives with business before his administration.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — It is the most visible and potent symbol of the ethics debate that has dogged President Trump as he has served simultaneously as the nation’s chief executive and real estate developer with a chain of luxury hotels. And now it is for sale.
articles.byline: By Eric Lipton and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Impeachment Inquiry Is Legal, Judge Rules, Giving Democrats a Victory
articles.snippet: The finding came in an order directing the Justice Department to hand over secret grand jury evidence from the Mueller investigation to House impeachment investigators.
articles.abstract: The finding came in an order directing the Justice Department to hand over secret grand jury evidence from the Mueller investigation to House impeachment investigators.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal judge handed a victory to House Democrats on Friday when she ruled that they were legally engaged in an impeachment inquiry, a decision that undercut President Trump’s arguments that the investigation is a sham.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Emily Cochrane

articles.headline: In Fire-Scarred California, ‘If You’re Told to Go, You Go’
articles.snippet: As wildfires raged across the state this week, tens of thousands of residents were ordered to evacuate their homes out of an abundance of caution.
articles.abstract: As wildfires raged across the state this week, tens of thousands of residents were ordered to evacuate their homes out of an abundance of caution.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Sign up for our daily newsletter about news from California.]
articles.byline: By Tim Arango and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: Microsoft Wins Pentagon’s $10 Billion JEDI Contract, Thwarting Amazon
articles.snippet: Amazon was considered a front-runner for the cloud computing project before President Trump began criticizing the company’s founder, Jeff Bezos.
articles.abstract: Amazon was considered a front-runner for the cloud computing project before President Trump began criticizing the company’s founder, Jeff Bezos.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — The Department of Defense on Friday awarded a $10 billion technology contract to Microsoft over Amazon in a contest that was closely watched after President Trump ramped up his criticism of Amazon’s founder, Jeff Bezos, and said he might intervene.
articles.byline: By Kate Conger, David E. Sanger and Scott Shane

articles.headline: Symbol of ’80s Greed Stands to Profit From Trump Tax Break for Poor Areas
articles.snippet: The financier Michael Milken is a major investor in a property that became eligible for a federal tax break — after his longtime friend, Steven Mnuchin, intervened.
articles.abstract: The financier Michael Milken is a major investor in a property that became eligible for a federal tax break — after his longtime friend, Steven Mnuchin, intervened.
articles.lead_paragraph: RENO, Nev. — In the 1980s, Michael Milken embodied Wall Street greed. A swashbuckling financier, he was charged with playing a central role in a vast insider-trading scheme and was sent to prison for violating federal securities and tax laws. He was an inspiration for the Gordon Gekko character in the film “Wall Street.”
articles.byline: By Eric Lipton and Jesse Drucker

articles.headline: ‘We’re Asking You to Dig Deep’: Biden Seeks to Steady Finances as Allies Fret
articles.snippet: Joe Biden’s presidential campaign is spending more money than it is taking in, unlike his top 2020 rivals, and showing an inability to galvanize big financial backers or energize many online donors.
articles.abstract: Joe Biden’s presidential campaign is spending more money than it is taking in, unlike his top 2020 rivals, and showing an inability to galvanize big financial backers or energize many online donors.
articles.lead_paragraph: Steve Ricchetti, one of Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s closest confidantes, is reaching out to wary donors to shore up support. The Biden presidential campaign is watching costs — some staff members are sleeping at homes of volunteers — and facing criticism for spending on chartered jets. Mr. Biden’s team is also urging allies to redouble fund-raising efforts before the calendar turns to 2020 and he has fewer days to devote to the money trail.

articles.headline: Waiting for Bolton: A Capital Speculates on What He Will Say
articles.snippet: As the House impeachment inquiry enters its second month, there may be no witness investigators want to question more than John R. Bolton, the president’s former national security adviser.
articles.abstract: As the House impeachment inquiry enters its second month, there may be no witness investigators want to question more than John R. Bolton, the president’s former national security adviser.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The message that John R. Bolton, President Trump’s former national security adviser, sent supporters of his newly reopened political action committee last week raised as many questions as it answered in a capital consumed by impeachment.

articles.headline: Catholic Bishops Back Ordination of Married Men as Priests in Amazon Region, a Milestone
articles.snippet: It was the first time a summit of bishops convened by a pope has endorsed such a historic change to the tradition of a celibate priesthood. The final decision will be up to the pope.
articles.abstract: It was the first time a summit of bishops convened by a pope has endorsed such a historic change to the tradition of a celibate priesthood. The final decision will be up to the pope.
articles.lead_paragraph: VATICAN CITY — A summit of Roman Catholic bishops meeting at the Vatican recommended on Saturday that Pope Francis allow the ordination of married men as priests in the Amazon region, which would lift a roughly 1,000-year-old restriction and potentially revolutionize the priesthood.

articles.headline: Before Deadly Crashes, Boeing Pushed for Law That Undercut Oversight
articles.snippet: The government has been handing over more responsibility to manufacturers for years. The new law makes it even harder for regulators to review Boeing’s work.
articles.abstract: The government has been handing over more responsibility to manufacturers for years. The new law makes it even harder for regulators to review Boeing’s work.
articles.lead_paragraph: With a few short paragraphs tucked into 463 pages of legislation last year, Boeing scored one of its biggest lobbying wins: a law that undercuts the government’s role in approving the design of new airplanes.
articles.byline: By Natalie Kitroeff and David Gelles

articles.headline: ISIS Leader al-Baghdadi Is Dead, Trump Says
articles.snippet: President Trump said in a nationally televised address that American forces targeted Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the head of the Islamic State, in an operation in Syria this weekend.
articles.abstract: President Trump said in a nationally televised address that American forces targeted Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the head of the Islamic State, in an operation in Syria this weekend.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump announced on Sunday that a daring American commando raid in Syria this weekend culminated in the death of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the leader of the Islamic State, after a five-year international manhunt, claiming a significant victory even as American forces are pulling out of the area.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Eric Schmitt and Helene Cooper

articles.headline: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, ISIS Leader Known for His Brutality, Is Dead at 48
articles.snippet: President Trump announced the death of al-Baghdadi, who transformed the Islamic State into a global terrorist network that conquered territory the size of Britain and directed horrific attacks in the West.
articles.abstract: President Trump announced the death of al-Baghdadi, who transformed the Islamic State into a global terrorist network that conquered territory the size of Britain and directed horrific attacks in the West.
articles.lead_paragraph: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the cunning and enigmatic black-clad leader of the Islamic State who transformed a flagging insurgency into a global terrorist network that drew tens of thousands of recruits from 100 countries, has died at 48.
articles.byline: By Rukmini Callimachi and Falih Hassan

articles.headline: Trump’s Syria Troop Withdrawal Complicated Plans for al-Baghdadi Raid
articles.snippet: President Trump’s abrupt decision to pull forces from northern Syria forced the Pentagon to press ahead with a risky night operation that killed the ISIS leader, military officials said.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s abrupt decision to pull forces from northern Syria forced the Pentagon to press ahead with a risky night operation that killed the ISIS leader, military officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump knew the Central Intelligence Agency and Special Operations commandos were zeroing in on the location for Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the Islamic State leader, when he ordered American troops to withdraw from northern Syria earlier this month, intelligence, military and counterterrorism officials said on Sunday.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt, Helene Cooper and Julian E. Barnes

articles.headline: Period-Tracking Apps Say You May Have a Disorder. What if They’re Wrong?
articles.snippet: Apps like Flo and Clue are shifting from just tracking your health data to using it to make evaluations about your health risks. Their tools may not always be accurate.
articles.abstract: Apps like Flo and Clue are shifting from just tracking your health data to using it to make evaluations about your health risks. Their tools may not always be accurate.
articles.lead_paragraph: Flo and Clue, two popular period-tracking apps, recently introduced health tools that evaluate a woman’s risk for the hormonal imbalance known as polycystic ovary syndrome.

articles.headline: With Whipping Winds and Power Down, Californians Flee Fires
articles.snippet: Power outages and fires combined over the weekend to push the state’s disaster response capabilities to the brink.
articles.abstract: Power outages and fires combined over the weekend to push the state’s disaster response capabilities to the brink.
articles.lead_paragraph: Update, Oct. 28: Read the latest on the fires, and sign up here for our California Today newsletter.
articles.byline: By Lauren Hepler, Jose A. Del Real and Ivan Penn

articles.headline: Al-Baghdadi Raid Was a Victory Built on Factors Trump Derides
articles.snippet: The president cast the death of the ISIS leader as validation of his disengagement strategy. But it required intelligence agencies and allies he has spurned.
articles.abstract: The president cast the death of the ISIS leader as validation of his disengagement strategy. But it required intelligence agencies and allies he has spurned.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The death of the Islamic State’s leader in a daring nighttime raid vindicated the value of three traditional American strengths: robust alliances, faith in intelligence agencies and the projection of military power around the world.

articles.headline: Disney Is New to Streaming, but Its Marketing Is Unmatched
articles.snippet: The company’s synergistic approach — think trailers playing on TVs in 22,000 Disney World hotel rooms — has made Disney Plus known to millions.
articles.abstract: The company’s synergistic approach — think trailers playing on TVs in 22,000 Disney World hotel rooms — has made Disney Plus known to millions.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Tom Bergeron, the host of the ABC reality show “Dancing With the Stars,” looked into the camera at the start of a recent Disney-themed episode and made a forceful sales pitch. Disney Plus, a new streaming service, was arriving on Nov. 12, he told the seven million people watching at home. With his voice rising, he added, “It’s available for you to pre-enroll right now!”

articles.headline: Aramco’s I.P.O. Will Be Less Gigantic Than Promised
articles.snippet: The state-owned oil giant is expected to announce soon that it plans to go public. But the stock sale will fall short of Saudi Arabia’s ambitions.
articles.abstract: The state-owned oil giant is expected to announce soon that it plans to go public. But the stock sale will fall short of Saudi Arabia’s ambitions.
articles.lead_paragraph: When Mohammed bin Salman announced in 2016 that he would list one of his country’s crown jewels — the state-owned oil giant Saudi Aramco — on the stock market, he set some audacious goals.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Stanley Reed

articles.headline: Elizabeth Warren’s Days Defending Big Corporations
articles.snippet: As Ms. Warren ascends toward the head of the Democratic presidential pack, her critics have seized upon her bankruptcy work for big corporations to question her progressive bona fides.
articles.abstract: As Ms. Warren ascends toward the head of the Democratic presidential pack, her critics have seized upon her bankruptcy work for big corporations to question her progressive bona fides.
articles.lead_paragraph: Elizabeth Warren had never taken on the federal government before.

articles.headline: Chinese Investment Pits Wall Street Against Washington
articles.snippet: Lawmakers and Trump officials want to stop federal employee retirement funds from flowing to Chinese companies.
articles.abstract: Lawmakers and Trump officials want to stop federal employee retirement funds from flowing to Chinese companies.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The rivalry between the United States and China has spread to a fight over financial ties between the countries, pitting Washington security hawks against Wall Street investors.
